Prasad wrote:
> Hello everybody,
> 
> Iam having a void method.(say x())
> In which it calls another void method.(say y())
> I have to test whether y() is called in x() or not using jmock.
> Can any one guide me to how to write the test case (programming)?

JMock's web site has excellent examples. Have you tried following them?

In English, we expect x() to invoke y() with some parameters, returning 
some value.

In JMock, we write something very close to this:

mockY.expect(once()).method("y").with(eq(param1), 
eq(param2)).will(returnValue("hello, there!"));

...where mockY is a mock of the interface on which method y() is located.

I hope that helps.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
